definition: to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)

sentences.english: Could the mind-wandering be a consequence rather than a cause of unhappiness?
sentences.chinese: 是否走神是不快乐的结果，而非诱因？

sentences.english: It can block and relieve forenamed variety by disbranching vagus nerve and depressor nerve.
sentences.chinese: 切断迷走神经和减压神经可以阻断或减轻上述变化。

sentences.english: If you’re distracted, in theory, then you’d eat more.
sentences.chinese: 理论上，如果你走神了，就会吃得更多。

sentences.english: Focus on the exercise, and do not daydream.
sentences.chinese: 集中注意力做练习，不要走神儿。

sentences.english: If your mind wanders, simply bring it back to your breathing.
sentences.chinese: 如果走神了，回到呼吸上。

sentences.english: I cannot bear the noise of my neighbor's radio; it distracts me from my work.
sentences.chinese: 我不能忍受邻居收音机的声音，它让我工作走神儿。

sentences.english: Then shut them off when you’re going to create.
sentences.chinese: 但当你开始着手创作时，一定不要走神。

sentences.english: Some primary afferent neurons were presented in the nodose ganglia.
sentences.chinese: 部分初级传入神经元位于迷走神经结状节内。

sentences.english: Light and electron microscopies of the nodose ganglion of vagus nerve were made in rats.
sentences.chinese: 本文对大鼠迷走神经结状节进行了光镜和电镜观察。

sentences.english: His absence of mind while driving nearly caused an accident.
sentences.chinese: 他驾驶时走神儿了，几乎出事故。

sentences.english: At the same time, distracted Gu also driving a BMW cold rushed.
sentences.chinese: 同时，走神的顾寒也驾驶着宝马冲了过来。

sentences.english: A driver who is driving the bus mustn’t talk with others or be absent-minded.
sentences.chinese: 司机在开车时，不许和人谈话，也不能走神。

sentences.english: Vagus nerve to control heart rate through breathing.
sentences.chinese: 迷走神经能通过呼吸来控制心率。

sentences.english: The vagus nerves have an inhibitory action on atrial pacemakers.
sentences.chinese: 迷走神经对心房起搏点有抑制作用。

definition: to be absent-minded/to desert/to abscond from the army/absent without leave (AWOL)
to stare blankly/to be stunned/to be lost in thought
to give attention to sth/please give (some of your valuable) attention to my task/to be distracted
to concentrate one's attention completely (idiom)/with rapt attention
to indulge in flights of fancy (idiom)/to let one's imagination run wild
to stare blankly/to be in a daze
